JMeter is cool for some things like testing performance under load of
messa=
ging APIs (like, say, HTML or SOAP).  But if you're talking about
performan=
ce of a non-messaging Java app, it's probably not what you
need.  You shoul=
d definitely look into JUnitPerf.  I used it years ago,
and I don't know if=
 it's JUnit 4 compatible or not.  But it was very
cool and lightweight and =
good for what I needed at the time.

http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPer=
f.html


Cheers,
Todd.
